segments.pli: Atha kho dve brāhmaṇā jiṇṇā vuddhā mahallakā addhagatā vayoanuppattā vīsavassasatikā jātiyā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu. Ekamantaṃ nisinnā kho te brāhmaṇā bhagavantaṃ etadavocuṃ:
segments.en: Then two old brahmins—elderly and senior, who were advanced in years and had reached the final stage of life, being a hundred and twenty years old—went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to the Buddha:

segments.pli: “mayamassu, bho gotama, brāhmaṇā jiṇṇā vuddhā mahallakā addhagatā vayoanuppattā vīsavassasatikā jātiyā;
segments.en: “We brahmins, Master Gotama, are old, elderly and senior, we’re advanced in years and have reached the final stage of life; we’re a hundred and twenty years old.
And we haven’t done what is good and skillful, nor have we made a shelter from fear.

segments.pli: Ovadatu no bhavaṃ gotamo, anusāsatu no bhavaṃ gotamo yaṃ amhākaṃ assa dīgharattaṃ hitāya sukhāyā”ti.
segments.en: Advise us, Master Gotama, instruct us! It will be for our lasting welfare and happiness.”

segments.pli: “Taggha tumhe, brāhmaṇā, jiṇṇā vuddhā mahallakā addhagatā vayoanuppattā vīsavassasatikā jātiyā;
segments.en: “Indeed, brahmins, you’re old, elderly and senior.
And you haven’t done what is good and skillful, nor have you made a shelter from fear.

segments.pli: Āditto kho ayaṃ, brāhmaṇā, loko jarāya byādhinā maraṇena.
segments.en: This world is burning with old age, sickness, and death.

segments.pli: Evaṃ āditte kho, brāhmaṇā, loke jarāya byādhinā maraṇena, yo idha kāyena saṃyamo vācāya saṃyamo manasā saṃyamo, taṃ tassa petassa tāṇañca leṇañca dīpañca saraṇañca parāyaṇañcāti.
segments.en: But restraint here by way of body, speech, and mind is the shelter, protection, island, refuge, and haven for the departed.
When your house is on fire,
And as the world is on fire
as the good deeds done while living.”

sections.title: Then two old brahmins—elderly and senior, who were advanced…

suttaplex.blurb: You can begin to practice even late in life: advice to elderly brahmins.
